instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Arrived with liquid damage. After replacing components board boots and chimes but no image or backlight. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_LCDVDD_SW</SIGNAL> 0V. Replaced <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> but 0v on pin 1 <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>. L9080 L9004 L9008 are good

Bad PCH?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
LCD must be first correctly recognized.
Check L9008, <RESISTOR>R9008</RESISTOR>/09 and their traces.
Also check voltage and diode mode to ground on CLK/DATA lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
I was talking about their values (between pins), not to ground.
You post now some readings w/o specifying which pins of the components tested.
